details.sidebarText:
Exiles from Beyond

These disgusting parasites originally manifested in the First World, but the fey denizens of that realm found them too awful to endure and exiled them to the Material Plane. Over time, the isqulugs sloughed off their fey features for new, more powerful bodies of their own. Reports of stranger variants flourishing in areas such as demon-defiled Tanglebriar and remote fungi-ridden vaults in Orv, however, suggest their foothold on Golarion has become more established than previously thought.
details.flavorText: The isqulug's appearance, though unsettling, might be its least awful aspect. The creature resembles a bipedal amphibian with tentacles instead of arms and a head composed of an undulant mass of what appear to be shifting, slimy transparent eggs filled with writhing larvae. In truth, these larvae constitute the mind and consciousness of the isqulug—its “body” is little more than an organic suit manufactured from the flesh of those it has consumed, analogous to the complex web of a spider or the hive of a colony of bees, but fully capable of movement and violence.

description.value: An isqulug can precisely sense any creature infected with isqulugia within 30 feet, and knows the current stage of the disease.
This monster can see in all directions simultaneously, and therefore can’t be flanked.

This monster regains the listed number of Hit Points each round at the beginning of its turn. Its @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] condition never increases beyond @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 3 as long as its regeneration is active. However, if it takes damage of a type listed in the regeneration entry, its regeneration deactivates until the end of its next turn. Deactivate the regeneration before applying any damage of a listed type, since that damage might kill the monster by bringing it to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Dying] 4.

This monster doesn’t have a single mind (typically because it’s a swarm of smaller creatures), and is immune to mental effects that target only a specific number of creatures. It is still subject to mental effects that affect all creatures in an area.

The isqulug expels larvae from the hivemind in its head in a 30-foot cone. Creatures in this area take [[/r 6d10 # piercing damage]] piercing damage as the swarm feeds on their flesh (DC 30 basic Reflex save). Any creature that takes damage is exposed to isqulugia. The isqulug becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Stupefied] 1 for 1d4 rounds, during which it can't Expel Infestation.

Isqulugia's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Sickened], @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Slowed], and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Paralyzed] conditions can't be removed until this affliction is removed; Saving Throw DC 30 Fortitude; Stage 1 sickened 1 (1 hour); Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.Fatigued] and sickened 2 (1 day); Stage 3 fatigued and slowed 1 (1 day); Stage 4 paralyzed (1 day); Stage 5the creature dies, and its body violently transforms into a new isqulug. @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, similar magic, or a 9th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.kqhPt9344UkcGVYO]{Resurrect} ritual can return the victim to life. The new isqulug remains even if the victim is brought back to life.

The isqulug can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeeze} through tight spaces as if it were a Small creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed. The isqulug can even Squeeze through spaces that typically fit only a Tiny creature, but does so at the standard speed for Squeezing.
An isqulug ignores difficult terrain that's caused by typical features of swamps.

Dense, twitching creepers sprout from every surface and fill any bodies of water in the area. Any creature moving on the land, or Climbing or Swimming within the creepers, takes a –10- foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds while in the area. Once per round, you can make a vine lash out from any square within the expanse of creepers by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This vine has a 15-foot reach and makes a melee unarmed attack using your spell attack modifier. If the attack succeeds, the vine pulls the target into the creepers and makes it @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round or until the creature Escapes (against your spell DC), whichever comes first.
description.label: Description

description.value: By imposing your will upon the water, you can raise or lower the level of water in the chosen area by 10 feet. Water creatures in the area are subjected to the effects of slow.
description.label: Description

description.value: Plants in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.
description.label: Description

description.value:
You create an illusion that causes natural terrain to look, sound, feel, and smell like a different kind of terrain. This doesn't disguise any structures or creatures in the area. Any creature that touches the illusion or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.

Heightened Your image can also disguise structures or create illusory structures (but still doesn’t disguise creatures).
description.label: Description

duration.value: until the next time you make your daily preparations
duration.label: Duration

description.value: You call forth a cloud of mist. All creatures within the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and all creatures outside the mist become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to creatures within it. You can Dismiss the cloud.
description.label: Description

description.value:
The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

Heightened The duration increases to 1 hour.
description.label: Description

description.value: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.
description.label: Description
